alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; Crow Wing; Koochiching; North Cass; North Itasca; North St. Louis; Northern Aitkin; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; South Cass; South Itasca; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 6:14AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW WITH SLICK TRAVEL CONDITIONS POSSIBLE... Rain will mix with or change to snow or freezing rain tonight from northwest to southeast. There is potential for slick roadways and some travel impacts. Light snow accumulations of an inch or less are expected along with some ice accumulation. In addition, temperatures will be falling to or below freezing which could further create some slick roads. The wintry mix will continue through Christmas into Tuesday morning. The greatest impacts will occur after midnight tonight through Monday night. Freezing rain and snow may quickly coat roadways with a thin layer of ice that may be undetectable. Please use extreme caution... especially on bridges...overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
